page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ROLL TRIM - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the functional test of the roll trim. B. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Make sure that there are no persons or equipment in the aileron travel area. (3) Energize the aircraft with the external power supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/ 200). (4) Pressurize the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (5) Make sure that the AILERON SHUTOFF SYS 1 and AILERON SHUTOFF SYS 2 pushbutton lights are off. (6) Install the digital protractor (GSE 070) on the aileron (Figure 503). Use double-face adhesive tape for it. J. Functionally Check Roll Trim (Figure 501) (Figure 502) SUBTASK 720-002-A (1) Do a check of the roll trim timer. (a) Push the roll trim switch to the LWD position for approximately 3 seconds and measure the time from the command until the system is automatically turned off. Result: 1 The roll trim system is automatically turned off in 3 ÃÂ± 0.3 seconds. (b) Push the roll trim switch to the RWD position for approximately 3 seconds and measure the time from the command until the system is automatically turned off. Result: 1 The roll trim system is automatically turned off in 3 ÃÂ± 0.3 seconds. (2) Do a check of the roll trim indication. (a) Install rigging device GSE 076 on the Roll Trim Actuator. Result: 1 On the EICAS, the arrow of the roll trim indication must be at the neutral position. (b) Remove rigging device GSE 076 from the Roll Trim Actuator. (3) Do a check of the roll trim authority. (a) Put the aileron surface in the neutral position and set the dial protractor to zero. NOTE: The aileron surface is in the neutral position when the aileron and the wing trailing edge are aligned. (b) Push the roll trim switch to the RWD position for approximately 3 seconds, many times, until the actuator touches its stop. 1 Measure the right and left aileron surface deflection. NOTE: The left aileron deflection is (LA) and the right aileron deflection is (RA). 2 Add the values LA and RA. NOTE: The result of this addition is (TD): TD = LA + RA. Use absolute values. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL 3 The addition of these values must be ≥ 25 degrees. (c) If you find values < 25 degrees in two directions, cut the lockwire of the rod end of the AFU (Artificial Feel Unit) to adjust it. After you adjust the rod end of the AFU, safety it (AMM TASK 27-11-06-400-801-A/400). (d) Do steps (a) and (b) for the LWD position. (4) Do a check of the pilot Quick-Disconnect switch. (a) Operate the roll trim switch at the control pedestal. (b) While the system operates, push the pilot Quick-Disconnect switch, on the pilot control yoke, and keep it pushed. Result: 1 The system stops. (5) Do a check of the copilot Quick-Disconnect switch. (a) Operate the roll trim switch at the control pedestal. (b) While the system operates, push the copilot Quick-Disconnect switch, on the copilot control yoke, and keep it pushed. Result: 1 The system stops. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the digital protractor (GSE 070) and the double-face adhesive tape from the aileron. (2) Release the roll trim switch and push it again. Make sure that the aileron starts to move again. (3) Move the aileron to the neutral position with the Roll Trim Switch. (4) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (5) Release the pressure of the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 27-14-00 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
